CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 6, 1959, pg. A1, reads: "Leaving the Chapel - Six of his friends are shown above as they carried the remains of Jimmy Allen from the Jones Funeral Home Chapel, where burial rites were held on Monday. The pallbearers, reading from left to right, around the casket, were Max Newstein, Sam Podolsky, Jules Snyder (hidden from view), John L. Clark, Charles E. Turner and William Hannon. In front is Frank Dorsey, funeral director.  Lois M. Lee Dorsey was the mortician. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Six pallbearers, including Max Newstein, Sam Podolsky, Jules Snyder (hidden from view), John L. Clark, Charles E. Turner, and William Hannon carrying casket out of Jones Funeral Home, with Funeral Director Frank Dorsey in foreground, for funeral of James H. "Jimmy" Allen
